title: Hand-Drawn Doodle Recognition Using Deep Learning
description: Developed a full-stack deep learning application inspired by Google's Quick, Draw! to recognize hand-drawn sketches in real time. Trained a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) on 400,000+ images across 345 categories using the Quick, Draw! dataset. Achieved 61.15% validation accuracy and deployed the model as a TFLite version integrated with a FastAPI backend and TensorFlow.js frontend. The web app allows users to draw on a canvas and receive live predictions with top results and probabilities.

title: Steam Game Recommendation Engine
description: Worked on a master's project with Soumya and Harsha to develop a personalized game recommendation system for the Steam platform. Built a hybrid model using Collaborative Filtering (ALS), Content-Based Filtering (TF-IDF and cosine similarity), and Association Rule Mining (FP-Growth). The project involved extensive data preprocessing, feature engineering, and performance evaluation using RMSE and MSE, along with visualizations to interpret gaming behavior.

title: CPU Scheduling Algorithms Simulator
institution: NBKR Institute of Science and Technology
description: Built a CPU scheduling simulator in Python to replicate and analyze key operating system algorithms like FCFS, Round Robin, SPN, SRT, HRRN, Feedback, and Aging. Supported both trace-based and statistical analysis, offering insights into performance metrics like waiting time and turnaround time. Focused on algorithm design, efficient data structures, and real-time simulation logic without external libraries.

title: Detection of Malicious Social-Bots with URLs using Learning Automata
institution: NBKR Institute of Science and Technology
description: Developed a phishing and bot detection system using URL-based features and machine learning models (MLP, Naive Bayes, SVM). Implemented using Django with a MySQL backend and HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for the frontend. The model outperformed traditional decision tree and random forest methods in speed and accuracy.

title: Weather Report Application for Android and iOS using React Native
institution: NBKR Institute of Science and Technology
description: Developed and deployed a cross-platform mobile application using React Native. Integrated OpenWeather API to provide real-time weather data. Used Expo SDK for Android deployment and Xcode with CocoaPods for iOS deployment. Focused on responsive design and seamless user experience.
